title: The dialogues of Solomon and Saturn would not have been an inappropriate companion to what was already a compendious manuscript. They would have provided their owner with a poetic dialogue on the power of the Pater Noster, a prose section on the fight between the devil and the Pater Noster and a more traditional question-and-answer piece concerning time, nature, good and evil. In a liturgical context such as this, one could envision it fortifying the priest with knowledge, even providing him with ready answers to difficult questions
